div.p: Greetings. I have absolutely nothing to write at the moment, except that your most recent letter, dated March 12th, was delivered to me today.
I pray to the Lord to resolve these disturbances.
Nothing else is being written from elsewhere.
I am expecting letters from Heidelberg and Augsburg at any moment. I will commend your faithfulness and diligence to Mr. MÃ¼ller.
Greet the consuls, Mr. Carlin, Mr. Pontasella, and farewell.
Yesterday, our Sebastian Guldibek, afflicted by apoplexy, passed away to the Lord.
Thus, we are continually deprived of learned, good, and useful men.
What will happen, the Lord knows.
Farewell again and pray to the Lord for me.
To the most excellent man, Mr. Johannes Fabricius, faithful minister of the Church of Chur, my esteemed and beloved lord and brother.
